ai.name: Ask For It
ai.desc:
This guy is very bad at holding a secret...

Use the snicat tool to connect to the service.

Note: This is a challenge based on a LLM. It is experimental and can produce unexcepted results. In order to reduce token usage, the chat will be closed after 5 messages.

Author: algorab

crypto.name: Broken OTP
crypto.desc:
i heard OTP it the most secure encryption algorithm ever

Author: algorab

crypto.name: Crypto Rookie
crypto.desc:
Hey Rookie, decode this and I'll give you a cookie!

STSABEAOE OEIEALGSETRHNCOI MMFITTAK

The flag's format is N0PS{decoded message}.

Author: Sto

crypto.name: Side Channel
crypto.desc:
Your goal is to extract the key used for the encryption of the captured data.

All blocks have been encrypted in Electronic Codebook (ECB) mode.
All data blocks are in hexadecimal, byte 0 first, byte 15 last. First column: 128 bits input block, second column: 128 bits encrypted block, third column: encryption time.
The key length is 128 bits.
The format of the flag is N0PS{key} where key is the 32 digits hexadecimal representation of the secret key you found, byte 0 first, byte 15 last, with everything in capital letters.

If the correct key was 0102030405060708090A0B0C0D0E0F the following command would output the first ciphertext bloc in ta.dat: printf "$(sed -n 's/ .*//;s/\(..\)/\\x\1/gp;q' ta.dat)" | openssl enc -aes-128-ecb -nosalt -nopad -K 0102030405060708090A0B0C0D0E0F | od -v -A none -tx1

forensic.name: HID
forensic.desc:
what did I write ???

Author: algorab

jojo.name: Interception 1
jojo.desc:
We just captured this strange radio signal, on a frequency used by J3JuJ4 members. We need you to decode it.

Author: algorab

jojo.name: Jojo Chat 1
jojo.desc:
The kidnappers of Jojo have been developping their own chat platform. We need you to get an admin access on it, in order to stop their evil activities.

Use Jojo Chat 1/2 Instance for this challenge.

biiip biiip biiip biiip biiip bip biiip bip bip bip bip bip

Author: algorab

osint.name: Rockstar
osint.desc:
I recently went to this place, and I really liked the design of their menu. Can you tell me which software they used to make it?

Note: The flag will be N0PS{Name of the software}. A strict copy-paste of the value you will find has to be submitted. For example, if the software is Acrobat PDFMaker 8.1 for Word (Macintosh), the flag will be N0PS{Acrobat PDFMaker 8.1 for Word (Macintosh)}.

Author: algorab, Sto

osint.name: Where Am I
osint.desc:
u will never find where i am lollz

Note: The flag is the name of the place in ASCII lowercase (no special character, no commas), words separated by dash (-). For instance, if the place is Musée du Louvre, the flag will be N0PS{musee-du-louvre}.

Author: algorab

pwn.name: Mudiary
pwn.desc:
Use Mudiary Instance for this challenge.

musl.so is built with 'https://musl.libc.org/releases/musl-1.2.5.tar.gz'.

and compiled:

./configure --with-malloc=oldmalloc
make

Author: algorab

rev.name: Lizwol
rev.desc:
Help! I found this mysterious flag.enc file, and I have no clue what to do with it. Can you crack the code and give me the flag before I lose my mind in a word, LZW.?

rev.desc:
Don't complain if you can't see me, because I have to be reversed to make me run 🙃
